result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul J. Key Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Paul J. Key Jr. appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Tripp Stroud appeared by video for Paul J. Key Jr.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews information. Defendant pleads not guilty to all counts. Attorney Stroud heard, requests a status date, and plans to file a motion. Motion to be filed before status date. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Motion Hearing held following Preliminary Hearing regarding Def. Motion regarding medical treatment. Def. appeared in person, in custody with his Attorney Stroud. Attorney Wood appeared via phone. Attorney Stroud heard on motion. Attorney Wood heard on argument. Attorney Stroud heard on rebuttal. Attorney Wood heard briefly. Court heard regarding motion and has reviewed the motion and brief and affidavit of Sgt Reukauf. Finds GCJ has appropriately used their discretion for medical treatments and denies Defendant's motion.

Defendant Paul J. Key Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Paul J. Key Jr.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Benjamin R. Wood appeared by phone for County of Grant. Detective Jeremiah Hardy, sworn & testifies. Cross-examined. State - EX #1 - Officers reports, marked, offered & Rcvd. State requests Judicial Notice on Grant Co cases: 16CF212, 16CF78, 16CF72, 16CF69. Court takes notice. Counsel heard. State moves for bind over and Attorney Stroud objects and requests dismissal. He also requests judicial notice of prior cases be denied. State argues. Court reviewed complaint and exhibit. Finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Court addresses Judicial notice issue and agrees with State's argument. State is not ready for arraignment. Arraignment date set for 10/19/22 at 11:00 a.m. via zoom.
Arraignment scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plaintiff's response to defendant's motion for order requiring GSO to transport to out of state medical appointments
Preliminary hearing on September 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: for an order requiring the Grant County Sheriff to transport the defendant to scheduled medical appointments for treatment related to his amputated leg

Adjustment Number: 22A 005092,
Payable Number: 153923,
Receipt Number: 22R 008062,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Paul J. Key Jr. appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant did not contact SPD. Defendant's family has retained Attorney Tripp Stroud. Court finds good cause to waive preliminary hearing time limits. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on August 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Paul J. Key Jr. appeared by video from the Grant County Jail.  Attorney Lisa Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed the complaint, charges and penalties with the defendant. Address verified. Def. has not yet contacted SPD. Indicated he is currently employed at Skyline, but has been off work due to medical reasons. Court instructed him to contact SPD to see if he would qualify. District Attorney Riniker provided prior history/record and requesting $2000 cash bond. Defendant is currently on Supervision hold and indicated he could not come up with $2000.  Court sets $2000 cash bond. Status as to counsel set for 8/26/22 at 1:00 pm.
Review scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:00 am.
